Paragraph: To the best of our knowledge , this is the first reported case of ketoconazole - induced baboon syndrome in the English literature .

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, the disease entity is "ketoconazole-induced baboon syndrome" as it is a medical condition caused by the drug ketoconazole. The phrase "baboon syndrome" is also known as "acquired cutis aeliptica" or "generalized pigmented purpuric dermatosis," which is a rare side effect of ketoconazole.
